intro: Calystegia purpurata subsp. solanensis, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae). It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and large, showy flowers that range from white to pale purple in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
